abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Rural Investment Project
            for Azerbaijan were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory;
            risk to development outcome was negligible or low; Bank
            performance was satisfactory and borrower performance was
            also satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes:
            sustainability is a function of multiple factors. Moreover:
            sustainability is a continuum, rather than an absolute: the
            more factors are in play, the higher the likelihood of
            sustainable operation; and the actual factors at play in any
            given situation will differ, and need to be identified
            during project design, while allowing for additional factors
            to be included during implementation. Success breeds
            success. Considerable complementary investments became
            available once the successes were communicated, particularly
            by the beneficiaries themselves, using mass media. The
            institutional reforms that come with the introduction of a
            Community-Driven Development (CDD) operation lead to
            efficiency and effectiveness in their own right, but in
            addition, they are an excellent preparation for a fiscal
            decentralization effort. Without the institutional reforms
            under this CDD project such goals would be much harder to reach.

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            improving rural livelihoods in Azerbaijan. A critical
            challenge in Azerbaijan was to channel the dividends of
            oil-driven economic growth to the rural areas. The
            Azerbaijan Rural Investment Project supported the
            rehabilitation of critical infrastructure in poor
            communities across the country. The project has produced
            multiple gains in road improvements, school renovations and
            potable water quality, which resulted in improving the lives
            of some 6 million farmers and reducing poverty of some 1.5
            million people.
